fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: This question focuses on the transparency and predictability of the laws of the land.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Are the laws of the land clear, well publicized, coherent (consistent with each other), relatively stable from year to year, and enforced in a predictable manner?

fxInfo_responses.value: Transparency and predictability are almost non-existent. The laws of the land are created and/or enforced in completely arbitrary fashion.
Transparency and predictability are severely limited. The laws of the land are more often than not created and/or enforced in arbitrary fashion.
Transparency and predictability are somewhat limited. The laws of the land are mostly created in a non-arbitrary fashion but enforcement is rather arbitrary in some parts of the country.
Transparency and predictability are fairly strong. The laws of the land are usually created and enforced in a non-arbitrary fashion.
Transparency and predictability are very strong. The laws of the land are created and enforced in a non-arbitrary fashion.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2cltrnslw, *_osp, *_ord
